originalTitle: South Africa expels Israeli envoy over 'violations of diplomatic norms'
title: South Africa Says 'Goodbye' to a Special Helper!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! It's me, your kid-friendly news reporter, coming to you live with some important news. We're going to talk about something happening in a very special country in our big continent – South Africa! It's a land full of sunshine, amazing animals, and friendly people.

What Happened in Sunny South Africa?

Imagine you have a friend who comes to visit your house. You have rules in your house, right? Like, no jumping on the sofa, or always say 'please' and 'thank you'. Well, countries also have rules for how they talk to each other and how their special visitors should act. Something like this happened in South Africa. The grown-ups in charge there, who work for the government, said that a special helper from another country, Israel, needed to leave. This helper's name is Ariel Siedman. He was asked to pack his bags and go home. And he was given 72 hours to do it! That's like three whole days and three whole nights! Did you know? South Africa is famous for its beautiful beaches and incredible wildlife, like lions and elephants! It's at the very bottom of our amazing continent, Africa.

Who is Ariel Siedman?

So, who is Ariel Siedman? He's not just any visitor. He was a very important person called an 'envoy' or a 'diplomat'. What's a diplomat? Imagine a country is like a very, very big family. This family wants to talk to another very, very big family (another country). They can't just send a text message to everyone! So, they send a special messenger, a special friend, to live in the other country. This special friend, the diplomat, helps the two countries talk. They help solve problems, share ideas, and keep the friendship strong. Ariel Siedman was one of these special friends from Israel, living and working in South Africa. Did you know? Diplomats often live in a special building called an 'embassy' in the country they are visiting. It's like their country's home away from home!

What Does 'Expel' Mean?

When South Africa told Ariel Siedman to leave, it's called 'expelling' him. That's a big word, but it just means 'to ask someone to go away'. Think about it like this: If you had a friend playing at your house, and they kept breaking your house rules, even after you told them nicely, your parents might say, "Okay, it's time for your friend to go home now." That's a bit like what happened here. South Africa felt that Ariel Siedman had not followed the rules for special helpers from other countries. So, they asked him to go back to his own country, Israel. He had to leave within 72 hours, which is quite a short time to pack everything up! Did you know? 72 hours is exactly three days! That means if he was told on Monday morning, he would need to be gone by Thursday morning.

What are 'Diplomatic Norms'?

The reason South Africa asked Ariel Siedman to leave was because of 'violations of diplomatic norms'. Wow, those are some really big words! Let's make them simple. 'Diplomatic' means 'about countries talking to each other'. 'Norms' are just like 'rules' or 'ways we expect people to act'. So, 'diplomatic norms' are the special rules or good manners that countries and their special helpers (diplomats) follow when they are dealing with each other. These rules help make sure that countries can be friends, talk nicely, and solve problems without too much trouble. It's like when you play a game with your friends. You have rules for the game, right? Everyone knows the rules, and everyone tries to follow them. If someone breaks the rules all the time, it makes the game not fun, and it can cause problems. Did you know? These rules help countries avoid big arguments and try to find peaceful ways to agree.

Why Are These Rules Important?

These special rules are super important! They are like the glue that helps countries stick together and be friendly, even when they don't agree on everything. Imagine if every special helper from every country just did whatever they wanted, without following any rules. It would be very messy! Countries might get angry with each other, and it would be hard to talk and be friends. So, these rules, or 'diplomatic norms', are there to make sure everyone plays fair and respects each other's countries. They help keep the peace and make sure that countries can work together on important things, like helping people or protecting our planet. Did you know? Every country in the world agrees to follow these special rules so they can all be friends and neighbors on Earth!

Why Did South Africa Do This?

South Africa's government said that Ariel Siedman broke some of these important rules. They didn't say exactly what he did, but they felt it was serious enough to ask him to leave. It's like if your friend kept breaking the rules in your house, even after you asked them to stop. Your parents might feel sad, but they might decide it's best for your friend to go home for a little while. South Africa hopes that by asking him to leave, it will show everyone how important these rules are. They want all countries to respect the special ways that they talk and act with each other. This is about making sure everyone understands the importance of good manners and following the agreed-upon rules between countries.

What Happens Next?

Now, Ariel Siedman will go back to his home country, Israel. South Africa will still have other special helpers from Israel, but this one person had to leave. Countries will keep talking to each other, even when things are difficult. That's what special helpers, or diplomats, are for. They try to find ways for countries to get along, even after a disagreement. It's a reminder that even big countries, like big friends, sometimes have disagreements, but it's important to always try and find a way to be fair and friendly. And following the rules is a big part of that! Thank you for listening, my friends! Remember to always be kind, follow your rules, and be a good friend. See you next time for more news from our amazing continent, Africa!
summary: South Africa told a special helper from Israel, Ariel Siedman, to leave their country in 72 hours because he did not follow the special rules for how countries talk to each other.
whyMatters: This is important because countries need to follow rules to be friends and talk nicely, just like you follow rules to play nicely with your friends.

originalTitle: Music legend Fela Kuti becomes first African to get Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award
title: Music legend Fela Kuti becomes first African to get Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award
content: Almost 30 years after he died, the Nigerian will posthumously receive a Lifetime Achievement Award.

originalTitle: Burkina Faso junta announces ban on all political parties
title: Burkina Faso junta announces ban on all political parties
content: The multiparty system had been "promoting division among citizens", the country's interior minister said.

originalTitle: Giant Hind Rajab portrait unveiled in Spain for anniversary of her killing
title: Giant Hind Rajab portrait unveiled in Spain for anniversary of her killing
content: Activists unveiled a giant portrait of five-year-old Hind Rajab in Barcelona on the second anniversary of her killing.

title: Pakistan military raids kill 41 armed fighters in Balochistan
content: Military claims without providing evidence that the slain fighters were linked to India.

title: Netherlands watchdog probing Roblox over risks to children
content: Regulator launches investigation into US gaming platform over potential risks to underage users in the EU.

originalTitle: Syrian government reaches deal with Kurdish-led forces
title: Syrian government reaches deal with Kurdish-led forces
content: The deal will see the gradual integration of Kurdish forces and administration into the Syrian state.

originalTitle: Trump says 'it would be great' if US 'didn't have to use' military force on Iran
title: Trump says 'it would be great' if US 'didn't have to use' military force on Iran
content: The US president says he has told Iran it has to do "two things" to avoid military action, as the US builds up its forces in the Gulf.

originalTitle: Ukraine sees quieter night as Trump says Putin will not attack its cities
title: Ukraine sees quieter night as Trump says Putin will not attack its cities
content: Russia said the US president requested a pause in strikes on Kyiv until 1 February, a move Trump said was prompted by the cold weather.

originalTitle: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
title: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
content: Benfica will face Real Madrid in the Champions League play-offs just three weeks after their dramatic league phase encounter.

originalTitle: Celtic to play Stuttgart & Forest face Fenerbahce
title: Celtic to play Stuttgart & Forest face Fenerbahce
content: Celtic will play Stuttgart and Nottingham Forest will face Fenerbahce in two-legged play-offs to reach the last 16 of the Europa League.

originalTitle: Fulham sign Man City winger Bobb for £27m
title: Fulham sign Man City winger Bobb for £27m
content: Fulham sign Norway winger Oscar Bobb from Manchester City for £27m on a five-and-a-half-year contract.
